text-decoration: none;\">Vikhyat Singh</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/justice-cannot-be-blind-natural-justice_12.html?showComment=1476334670882#c5346888822984214923\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">October 13, 2016 at 10:27 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_46MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCAPTAIN,<br />\nAs per sanatan dharm, what is the nature of morality (subjective or objective)?</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_46BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_46b+seedJbCfD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_43T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_46b+seedJbCfD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_43TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_43TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_43TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_46b+seedJbCfD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_43TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_43TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_46b+seedJbCfD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_43TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_43TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_43TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_46b+seedJbCfD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_43B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2608628137158358488\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_43M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/justice-cannot-be-blind-natural-justice_12.html?showComment=1476339943963#c2608628137158358488\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">October 13, 2016 at 11:55 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_43MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi vs,<br />\n<br />\nDON\u2019T EVER BOTHER TO SEEK AN ANSWER TO YOUR QUESTION ( OBJECTIVE/ SUBJECTIVE MORALITY FROM ANY BOOK ON THIS PLANET OR FROM THE INTERNET.<br />\n<br />\nTHERE IS NOBODY WHO HAS THE FUCKIN\u2019 WISDOM TO ANSWER YOUR PROFOUND QUESTION .<br />\n<br />\nThe reason morality is subjective is because there is no common moral law that ALL people agree on.<br />\n<br />\nIf objective moral codes existed like \"murder is bad\" than there would be no murderers. But there are murderers. The reason most societies outlaw murder is because it is for the logical salvation of the society.<br />\n<br />\nObjective morality is the idea that a certain system of ethics or set of moral judgments is not just true according to a person's subjective opinion, but factually true.<br />\n<br />\nProponents of this theory would argue that a statement like \"Murder is wrong\" can be as objectively true as \"1 + 1 = 2.\"<br />\n<br />\nMost of the objective morals promoted today are grounded in Abrahamic religions .<br />\n<br />\nAmong Christians, it follows from the ideas of inherent human sinfulness and original sin that one's subjective moral instincts must be categorically classed as evil.<br />\n<br />\nIn claustrophobic Abrahamic religions , there is a pervasive message that whatever we're searching for is completely and utterly separate from us.<br />\n<br />\nAs per Sanatana Dharma morality has been ingrained within us. Somewhere deep down, embedded in our DNA, is the coding for morality. Somehow people know at a very young age that stealing is wrong.<br />\n<br />\nFor some, morality is something that is either taught, learned, or gained through familial contact or social interaction.<br />\n<br />\nYet there are people who didn't have good parents, or who had no parents at all, or who grew up without much social interaction or exposure to accessible information but who still know the basic \"rules\" for morality.<br />\n<br />\nFor others, morality seems to be something that we have to achieve or earn via some middle man in robes<br />\n<br />\nMorality isn't a rule. It isn't a plumb line. Morality cannot exists without context. Bhagawad Gita was the ultimate lesson in morality within the perimeter of context .<br />\n<br />\nMorality aint no tool to determine who is in and who is out. It is something that is part of each person. We don't earn morality; it earns us.<br />\n<br />\nMorality is a gene -- not one that we can see or study, but one that evolves progressively over time. Unlike other genes, it is affected and altered by the decisions we make and don't make. It is transformed by compassion and deformed by the lack of it.<br />\n<br />\nMorality is in us. We are all moral unless you have criminal DNA and the programming is corrupt.<br />\n<br />\nIts how we choose to use that knowledge that will determine how we nurture the growth of morality within us.<br />\n<br />\nSo, the origins of morality lie in each human being but are grown through the everyday process of making choices.<br />\n<br />\nLaws of Karma and Dharma has guided the Hindu since time immemorial . There was never any DOGMA lumped down the Hindu\u2019s throat.<br />\n<br />\nMorals are encouraged by living in a moral society or community. But they are birthed in each person, each individual. They are also spurred on by what we choose to expose our minds to.<br />\n<br />\nMoral subjectivity is not the enemy to the progress of any society; moral homogeneity is.<br />\n<br />\nMoral homogeneity says that everyone needs to see everything the same way, to fit into neat little boxes, and it is used to marginalize those who don't.<br />\n<br />\nMoral subjectivity leads a society to embrace diversity by seeing that a particular worldview isn't the only right one.<br />\n<br />\nA subjective morality is one rooted in human feelings and conscience .<br />\n<br />\nNatural justice is inherent. These are the things that are most important to us, indeed the only things important to us!<br />\n<br />\nDefinition of Subjective:--<br />\nProceeding from or taking place in a person's mind rather than the external world: a subjective decision.<br />\nParticular to a given person; personal: subjective experience.<br />\nsubjective dimension of conscience.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_43MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_43BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_43B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_44B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1343880030999237977\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_44M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/justice-cannot-be-blind-natural-justice_12.html?showComment=1476340093465#c1343880030999237977\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">October 13, 2016 at 11:58 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_44MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nDefinition of Objective:-<br />\n<br />\nOf or having to do with a material object.<br />\nHaving actual existence or reality.<br />\nUninfluenced by emotions or personal prejudices: an objective critic.<br />\nBased on observable phenomena; presented factually: an objective appraisal.<br />\nEverything is subjective as soon as it is experienced or thought by a human being.<br />\nObjective moral values are moral values that are true independent of the belief of human beings.<br />\n<br />\nRELIGION IS OBJECTIVE .<br />\nSPIRITUALITY IS SUBJECTIVE.<br />\n<br />\nOBJECTIVE IS OUTSIDE OF HUMAN BEINGS. WHEN A SHIP INCPECTOR INSPECTS THE SHIP, HE MUST BE OBJECTIVE. HE MUST NOT ALLOW HIS EMOTIONS TO RULE.<br />\n<br />\nSAME WITH A JUDGE IN A COURT. NATURAL JUSTICE AND CONSCIENCE IS LOCKED UP AND THROWN AWAY.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS SUITED JEW ROTHSCHILDWHO ENSLAVED INDIA.<br />\n<br />\nROTHSCHILD CREATED ASHTAVAKRA GITA AND HAS USED HIS FAKE GURUS TO PROPATE IT SANATA DHARMA IS NOT LIKE THE TEN COMMANDMENTS SYSTEM OF SINGLE MESSIAH CHRISTIANITY.<br />\n<br />\nWE HINDUS DO NOT NEED A MESSIAH TO TELL US WHAT IS RIGHT AND WHAT IS WRONG.<br />\n<br />\nLIKE THIS BLOGSITE HINDUSIM TELLS ALL TO USE THEIR CONSCIENCE. OBJECTIVE MORALITY BREEDS FALSE EXCUSES<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nTANGIBLE LAW IS THE OBJECTIVE FORM OF MORALITY. OBJECTIVE IS INDEPENDENT OF PEOPLEs OPINIONS.<br />\n<br />\nOBJECTIVE MORALS FOR CHRISTIANS EMANATE FROM THE TEN COMAMNDMENTS.<br />\n<br />\nOBJECTIVE MORALITY IGNORED CONTEXT .<br />\n<br />\nCHRISTIAN / ISLAM MORALITY IS OBJECTIVE, THE SINGLE MESSIAH AND SINGLE HOLY BOOK DICTATES DOGMA.<br />\n<br />\nATHEIST COMMUNISTS AND SINGLE MESSIAH / HOLYBOOK RELIGIONS ARE OBJECTIVE WITH MORALITY. THEY HAVE FAILED .<br />\n<br />\nRELIGION IS DOING WHAT YOU ARE TOLD REARDLESS OF WHAT IS RIGHT.<br />\n<br />\nRULES DON\u2019T MAKE US MORAL.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nSANATANA DHARMA IS SUBJECTIVE.<br />\n<br />\nSUBJECTIVE IS STRICTLY WITHIN HUMANS BEINGS \u2013IT DERIVES FROM OUR INTANGIBLE CONSCIENCE ALONE.<br />\n<br />\nIN SUBJECTIVE MORALITY PERCEPTION WITHIN PERIMETER OF CONTEXT IS PARAMOUNT.<br />\n<br />\nSUBJECTIVE IS DEPENDENT ON PEOPLEs OPINIONS.<br />\n<br />\nSANATANA DHARMAIS BASED ON CONSCIOUS HUMAN CONSCIENCE. NO MAN CAN MANIPULATE OR SILENCE HIS CONSCIENCE. WE ARE NOT THE SOURCE OF OUR OWN CONSCIENCE.<br />\n<br />\nBHAGAWAD GITA IS OUR GUIDE NOT ASHTAVAKRA GITA COOKED UP BY JEW ROTHSCHILD WITH Dos AND DONTs<br />\n<br />\nENEMIED OF HINDUISM USES FAKE GURUS LIKE TRIPLE SRI TO CONVERT SANATANA DHARMA TO AN OBJECTIVE RELIGION. SORRY, IT WONT WORK<br />\n<br />\nSPIRITUALLY SOAKED HINDUS ARE SUBJECTIVE WITH MORALITY. ONLY THIS WORKS<br />\n<br />\nMORALITY IS DOING WHAT IS RIGHT, REARDLESS OF WHAT YOUR ARE TOLD.<br />\n<br />\nSUBJECTIVE MORALITY HAS NO SCOPE FOR EXCUSES. LOVE , COMPASSION AND FAIRNESS MAKE US MORAL.<br />\n<br />\nHinduism was developed along spiritual lines, NOT religious lines\u2014the reason why 800 years of slavery could NOT stamp out this amazing way of life..<br />\n<br />\nHindusim is NOT a religion, it is the practise of spirituality by elevating human consciousness in the personal quest for truth.<br />\n<br />\nIndia and Bali are the last pockets of spirituality on this planet. Why do you think the spirituality seeking white man goes to these places in droves?<br />\n<br />\nThese foreigners can comprehend that Hinduism is based on reason and NOT faith -- unless the faith is an extension of reason.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_44MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_44BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_44B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_45B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3020837039899982921\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_45M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/justice-cannot-be-blind-natural-justice_12.html?showComment=1476340124992#c3020837039899982921\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">October 13, 2016 at 11:58 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_45MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nHindusim is a relentless pursuit of truth, flexible to suit all situations.<br />\n<br />\nAt the heart of Hinduism remains mans' essential quest for union with the Absolute supreme the brahmAn. In addition to tradition and moral order, it also signifies the path of knowledge and correct action ( Dharma ).<br />\n<br />\nIslam and Christianity are religions. These religions had Inquisitions.<br />\n<br />\nJews were too busy following their VULGAR and racist Talmud.<br />\n<br />\nAhimsa ( non-violence ) even vegetarianism , is a characteristic of Hinduism\u2014due to which vile foreign invaders took advantage..<br />\n<br />\nWhat the waitress calls SAFFRON TERROR -- is just the hindus making a free choice NOT to be cowards anymore and giving back as good as they got.<br />\n<br />\nToday when a patient and tolerant Hindu gets outraged and decides to retaliate, rivers of blood flows on the streets .<br />\n<br />\nHinduism can never dream of all this for openness and inclusivity is the essence of Hinduism.<br />\n<br />\nHinduism is a spiritual code. Know thyself is the quintessence.<br />\n<br />\nHinduism has a total lack of compulsions. You cannot get ex-communicated for NOT toeing the line.<br />\n<br />\nThe diversity, the range, and the lofty metaphysical aspirations of Vedanta are mindboggling.<br />\n<br />\nLoaded truth is delivered or revealed from a divine source and enters the world through a single agent: for example, Abraham in Judaism, Jesus Christ in Christianity, and Muhammad in Islam.<br />\n<br />\nThese truths are then recorded in scriptures that serve as a source of knowledge of divine wisdom: the Hebrew Bible, the New Testament of the Christian Bible, and the Koran. In the Hindu tradition, by utter contrast, there is no single revelation.<br />\n<br />\nThe Hindu spirituality tradition , unlike other religions -- has always concerned itself with the \u201chuman\u201d situation rather than the \u201cour religion \u201c situation.<br />\n<br />\nUnder the doctrine of karma, the ability to make choices remains with the individual-and NOT what is being told as gospel in a holy book .<br />\n<br />\nAsk the Jews\u2014they will say India is the only place where they never got persecuted over thousands of years\u2014they always ran here for refuge.<br />\n<br />\nThe reason ?<br />\n<br />\nThis country had denizens steeped in spirituality \u2014 NOT religious bigots. Hebrew religion and Hinduism co-existed.<br />\n<br />\nYet today foreign funded Indian TV calls all Hindus bigots \u2013what a joke !.<br />\n<br />\nI AM LUCKY TO BE BORN IN INDIA\u2014 HAVING SEEN WHAT THE REST OF THIS PLANET HAS TO OFFER FOR 40 YEARS .!<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_46b+seedJbCfD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_46b+seedJbCfD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>############# LIES , DAMN LIES !</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">White lies are MINOR\nlies&nbsp; as per the white man.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not any more !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We Indians call a\nwhite&nbsp; fuckin\u2019 lie a MAJOR lie<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white man says\nthat&nbsp; white lies are used to shield\nsomeone from a hurtful or emotionally damaging truth..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">APPIDIYAAA ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We Indians consider it\nthe other FOUL extreme \u2013it is to screw someone totally\u2014hook, line and sinker.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/02/black-is-black-white-is-white-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/02/black-is-black-white-is-white-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spin is all about\ndeception. &nbsp;Sometimes the spinners don't\nbother with complex methods to cover-up deception. Outright lies and deliberate\nomissions can work on a gullible audience too.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Propaganda,\"\nGoebbels once wrote, \"has absolutely nothing to do with truth.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because politicians\npull many of these standard stunts on you every election year, and you have\ngrown immune to some of them. And modern advertising uses a lot of them, too,\nand you just tune them out. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A lie by omission\noccurs when an important fact is left out in order to foster a misconception.\nLying by omission includes failures to correct pre-existing misconceptions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Political leanings may\nlead to lying by partisan reporting, in which scandals involving one party as\nfront page news while similar incidents among another are relegated to bylines\nburied towards the back of the newspaper. Whether or not this is lying by\nomission depends on the stated goal of the outlet in question.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A lie of omission is a\nlie in which someone deliberately withholds pertinent details about something\nin order to skew someone else's idea of the truth or engender a misconception.\nAlthough a lie of omission is not technically a lie because it contains no\nfalse information, it is still referred to as one colloquially because it is\ndeliberately misleading.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lies of omission can\noccur over both the short and long term. For example, if a car salesman says\nthat a car is regularly inspected yet neglects to say that a major defect was\nrevealed upon the last inspection, he commits a lie of omission in the short\nterm. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A lie by omission\noccurs when an important fact is left out in order to foster a misconception.\nLying by omission includes failures to correct pre-existing misconceptions. For\nexample, when the seller of a car declares it has been serviced regularly but\ndoes not tell that a fault was reported at the last service, the seller lies by\nomission. It can be compared to dissimulation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An omission is when a\nperson tells most of the truth, but leaves out a few key facts that therefore\ncompletely change the story.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A lie is a statement\nthat the stating party believes to be false and that is made with the intention\nto deceive.. Lies may be employed to serve a variety of instrumental,\ninterpersonal, or psychological functions for the individuals who use them. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Generally, the term\n\"lie\" carries a negative connotation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Believing and acting on\nfalse information can have serious consequences. Therefore, scientists and\nothers have attempted to develop reliable methods for distinguishing lies from\ntrue statements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A barefaced (or\nbald-faced) lie is one that is obviously a lie to those hearing it<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A big lie &nbsp;attempts to trick the victim into believing\nsomething major which will likely be contradicted by some information the\nvictim already possesses, or by their common sense. &nbsp;When the lie is of sufficient magnitude it may\nsucceed, due to the victim's reluctance to believe that an untruth on such a\ngrand scale would indeed be concocted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bluffing is an act of\ndeception that is rarely seen as immoral when it takes place in the context of\na game, such as poker, where this kind of deception is consented to in advance\nby the players.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For instance, a gambler who deceives other players into\nthinking he has different cards to those he really holds, or an athlete who\nhints he will move left and then dodges right is not considered to be lying\n(also known as a feint or juke). In these situations, deception is acceptable\nand is commonly expected as a tactic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While a lie is related\nby a speaker who believes what is said is false, bullshit is offered by a\nspeaker who does not care whether what is said is true because the speaker is\nmore concerned with giving the hearer some impression.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus bullshit may be\neither true or false, but demonstrates a lack of concern for the truth which is\nlikely to lead to falsehoods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A cover-up may be used\nto deny, defend or obfuscate one's errors, one's embarrassing actions or\nlifestyle, and one's lies that was made previously.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Defamation is the\ncommunication of a false statement that harms the reputation of an individual\nperson, business, product, group, government, religion, or nation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deflecting is avoiding\nthe subject that the lie is about, not giving attention to the lie. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Economy with the truth\nis popularly used as a euphemism for deceit, whether by volunteering false\ninformation (i.e., lying) or by deliberately holding back relevant facts. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An exaggeration occurs\nwhen the most fundamental aspects of a statement are true, but only to a\ncertain degree. It is also seen as \"stretching the truth\" or making\nsomething appear more powerful, meaningful, or real than it actually is. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A fabrication is a lie,\nit is something made up, or it is a misrepresentation of the truth. Often\npropaganda is fabrication.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A fib is a lie that is\nconsidered easy to forgive due to revolving around trivial matters, e.g. a\nchild fibbing that the family dog broke a vase, when in actuality the child\naccidentally broke it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fraud refers to the act\nof inducing another person or people to believe a lie in order to secure\nmaterial or financial gain for the liar. Depending on the context, fraud may\nsubject the liar to civil or criminal penalties<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A half-truth is a\ndeceptive statement that includes some element of truth. The statement might be\npartly true, the statement may be totally true but only part of the whole\ntruth, or it may employ some deceptive element, such as improper punctuation,\nor double meaning, especially if the intent is to deceive, evade, blame or\nmisrepresent the truth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A misleading statement\nis one where there is no outright lie, but still retains the purpose of getting\nsomeone to believe in an untruth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A noble lie is one that\nwould normally cause discord if uncovered, but offers some benefit to the liar\nand assists in an orderly society, therefore, potentially beneficial to others.\nIt is often told to maintain law, order and safety.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In psychiatry,\npathological lying (also called compulsive lying, pseudologia fantastica and\nmythomania) is a behavior of habitual or compulsive lying<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Perjury is the act of\nlying or making verifiably false statements on a material matter under oath or\naffirmation in a court of law, or in any of various sworn statements in\nwriting. Perjury is a crime, because the witness has sworn to tell the truth\nand, for the credibility of the court to remain intact, witness testimony must\nbe relied on as truthful.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A polite lie is a lie\nthat a politeness standard requires, and which is usually known to be untrue by\nboth parties. Whether such lies are acceptable is heavily dependent on culture.\nA common polite lie in international etiquette is to decline invitations\nbecause of \"scheduling difficulties\".&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Indian culture when a\nprospective bride/ groom is rejected\u2014we say the horoscopes did NOT match. This\nis left at that.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Puffery is an\nexaggerated claim typically found in advertising and publicity announcements,\nsuch as \"the highest quality at the lowest price\", or \"always\nvotes in the best interest of all the people\". Such statements are\nunlikely to be true \u2013 but cannot be proven false and so do not violate trade\nlaws, especially as the consumer is expected to be able to tell that it is not\nthe absolute truth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The phrase\n\"speaking with a forked tongue\" means to deliberately say one thing\nand mean another or, to be hypocritical, or act in a duplicitous manner. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When one lies, one\nundermines trust in society.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Propensity to lie\nvaries greatly between children, some doing so habitually and others being\nhabitually honest. Habits in this regard are likely to change in early\nadulthood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muslim can tell lies as\nper quran if the person is threatened and wants to safeguard himself. Also, to\nprotect Islam, one can tell lies. &nbsp;The practice\nis known as Taqiyya.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>################# BURY\nTHE LEAD </b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Burying the lead (\npronounced as leed ) &nbsp;is a newspaper\nterm. It means that you hide the most important fact in the story down at the\nbottom of the article.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, a recent\nnewspaper article about the soaring price of oil tried to explain the price\nincreases in terms of speculators buying oil futures, and political instability\nin foreign countries causing uncertainty in the market. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then they gradually got\naround to mentioning that India and China have booming economies that want ever\nmore oil. And then finally, in the last sentence of the article, someone said,\n\"Oil is getting harder to find.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A lead paragraph (also\ncalled a lede) in journalism and sometimes other kinds of literature is the\nopening paragraph of an article, essay, news story or book chapter. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Often called the lead,\nit usually occurs together with the headline or title. It precedes the main\nbody of the article, and it gives the reader the main idea of the story. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In journalism, the\nfailure to mention the most important, interesting or attention-grabbing\nelements of a story in the first paragraph is sometimes called \"burying\nthe lead\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Historically, one of\nthe best examples of Burying The Lead was when the New York Times casually\nmentioned in a small article on page 9 of an issue, many months after the Year\n2000 Presidential election, that if we had counted all of the votes (which is,\nafter all, what you are supposed to do in a democracy), that Al Gore actually\nwon the election, not Bush .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WEPz6f64wDI/V_9tegwtaiI/AAAAAAABMxo/wpVDuqtWV746W2SpKwYhBW0KQdAWFr97ACLcB/s1600/dottwnload.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"301\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WEPz6f64wDI/V_9tegwtaiI/AAAAAAABMxo/wpVDuqtWV746W2SpKwYhBW0KQdAWFr97ACLcB/s400/dottwnload.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">################## USE\nASSOCIATION</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Association is just\nlinking together two unrelated things. Often, it creates an emotional reaction\nin the intended audience. It can be anything like Guilt by Association, Honor\nby Association, or Desirability by Association, depending on what somebody or\nsomething is associated with.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advertisers routinely\nassociate beautiful women in skimpy clothes with new cars, cigarettes,\nalcoholic beverages, clothes, and diamond jewelry.&nbsp;&nbsp; TV commercials teach us that we can get laid\nif we use the right toothpaste and the right under-arm deodorant. So we have\nbeen programmed to consciously or unconsciously associate sex with all kinds of\nstrange things.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A corollary to\nassociation is something that I like to call \"reverse association\" \u2014\nbasking in reflected glory by honoring others (who may be totally out of your\nleague).&nbsp;&nbsp; An easy way to accomplish that\nis to hand out \"awards\", honoring others for something or other.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An interesting example\nof \"reverse association\" is: Federal Reserve Chairman JEW Alan\nGreenspan received the Enron Prize for Distinguished Public Service from Ken\nLay in November, 2001, less than three weeks before Enron filed for bankruptcy.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">American politicians\nroutinely wave the American flag and praise God, country, Democracy, Freedom,\nMom and apple pie, pop and mom store trying to create links in people's minds\n(associations) between themselves and those other positive images.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Likewise, many\ncommercials teach us to associate sugar consumption with happiness. Children\nare taught by TV commercials that eating gobs of sugar is really a lot of fun,\nand parents are taught that giving sugary Coke to children is how they show the\nchildren love.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Politicians also\nroutinely kiss babies, hug children, and hobnob with other, more popular and\npowerful politicians, to look good by association. They also love to rub elbows\nwith the rich, the famous, and the beautiful people, like movie stars and\nsports heroes, for the same reason.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And of course they want to be photographed\nwith a good selection of wise men like university professors, Nobel prize\nwinners, and high-ranking religious leaders, to look good by association.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Honor by\nassociation\u2014Jews get more Nobel Prizes than Muslims \u2013so Jews are smarter than\nMuslims. They don\u2019t tell you the Alfred Nobel was a Jew and Jew Rothschild\u2019s\npartner at Baku in the oil business.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In many advertisements,\nbusinesses heavily use the principle of honor by association. For example, an\nattractive spokesperson will say that a specific product is good. The\nattractiveness of the spokesperson gives the product good associations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A form of the\nassociation fallacy often used by those denying a well-established scientific\nor historical proposition is the so-called \"Galileo Gambit.\" The\nargument goes that since Galileo was ridiculed in his time but later\nacknowledged to be right, that since their non-mainstream views are provoking\nridicule and rejection from other scientists, they will later be recognized as\ncorrect too.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So salt and pepper your\nspeeches with zillions of flowery phrases and wonderful-sounding words and\nvague glittering generalities:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"God, country, Mom\nand apple pie\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Patriotism,\nFreedom, Democracy, and the good old USA\"</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"inspiration and\nliberty for all\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recently, an American\npolitical cartoon asked the question, \"What Would Mohammed Drive?\"\nand answered it with a drawing of a man dressed in Muslim garb driving a rental\ntruck with a missile hanging out the back.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Propaganda, both by\ngovernments and the private media, has evolved over the years as media has\nevolved. But, some say, the principle remains the same. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dehumanization is the\npsychological process whereby opponents view each other as less than human and\nthus not deserving of moral consideration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term demonization\nis similar to dehumanization in that it makes the opponent seem subhuman, but\nnot because they are an animal; they are a demon; evil incarnate. Although\nthese processes can be used alone, the two processes are often used in\nconjunction with one another.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aside from psychopathic\npersonalities, human beings (including soldiers) have consciences and feelings.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They have the capacity to feel guilty for their actions. Whether by mass\nmovement, or by a state-run propaganda campaign, it is dehumanization and/or\ndemonization of the enemy which gives the best possible motivation to carry out\nthe horrendous acts associated with torture, war, politicide, and genocide.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After all, it is easier to kill a poisonous black mamba&nbsp; or vermin; to engage in a holy war against a\ndemon or devil, then to kill a fellow human being.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dehumanization and\ndemonization are key components to a successful killing campaign, without\nwhich, the world could find the key to the prevention of a lot of unnecessary\nconflicts. If people, especially leaders, would cease using these tactics, then\nthe world would be able to see a lot less violence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human beings are\nreasoning creatures. Just like solving x to find y, we need to solve\n\"why\" to find x. X may be murder, rape, torture, or even\nname-calling.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; There is a rationality\nof genocide just as there is a rationality of business or athletics, or war or\nscience.\"&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Various forms of\nrationality have a history rooted in activities within which problems are\nconstituted and solutions are found. Genocidal solutions have strong roots;\nthey don't appear overnight.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In I Samuel, 15:3 of the Old Testament, \"Now\ngo and smite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them\nnot, but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and\nass.\"&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even while dehumanizing\nanother, during war, soldiers dehumanize themselves. They realize that they are\nexpendable, and this can make it easier to kill the enemy, whom is even more\nexpendable. They may come to see just one life, their own included, as\ninsignificant in the grand scheme of things.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lifting the veil of dehumanization\nand demonization can greatly increase the odds of de-escalating a conflict, or\neven of conflict prevention. Rather than seeing another party as evil and as\none who enjoys inflicting suffering, the adversary can be seen as a fellow\nhuman being who also suffers from the conflict, and who can be accepted as part\nof the same moral community <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Restoring humanity to\nan enemy not only makes it less likely to kill them, but making an enemy appear\nto be worthy is a \"noble kill.\" Honoring a fallen foe can actually\nhave a positive effect on the conscience of the killer. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>6000 YEARS AGO IN THE\nMAHABHARATA WAR , OPPONENTS WERE RESPECTED.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN STALWARTS FELL , THE WAR STOPPED TEMPORARILY AND BOTH SIDES MOURNED\nAND PAID CONDOLENCES TO THEIR RELATIVES .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>THE WAR WOULD THEN BEGIN ONLY THE NEXT DAY AT SUNRISE.</b></span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/mahabharata-and-bhagawat-gita-4000-bc.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/mahabharata-and-bhagawat-gita-4000-bc.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wqPZijJl_-8/WACR0S0na5I/AAAAAAABMyk/3yu_7TWuTWQguUTov3caiEIiJKmABYhhQCLcB/s1600/bhishma-pQQitamah.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"434\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wqPZijJl_-8/WACR0S0na5I/AAAAAAABMyk/3yu_7TWuTWQguUTov3caiEIiJKmABYhhQCLcB/s640/bhishma-pQQitamah.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The image of an enemy\nheld by a \"reasonable man\" may be one where the enemy is a decent\nman, but perhaps \"temporarily misguided by false doctrines or forced to\nmake war against his better will and desire.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Spanish-American\nWar, the United States took advantage of the sinking of the Maine in the port\nof Havana, even at the time, arguments were made that it was an accident, which\nlater was found to be almost assuredly the case, to start a war against weak\nSpain in an attempt to grab its colonies in Cuba, Puerto Rico, Guam, and the\nPhilippines. In reality it was the JEW taking revenge against Catholic Spain\nfor past misdemeanors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/explosion-on-ss-maine-grooming-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/explosion-on-ss-maine-grooming-of.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That Japanese attack at\nPearl Harbour was made in desperation, because the United States, then the world\u2019s\nlargest oil producer, had cut off the supplies of petroleum and other key\nmaterials to the island nation in an attempt to economically strangle Japan for\ncolonizing China by force.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FDR refused the\nJapanese prime minister\u2019s attempt to negotiate an end to the dispute; the \u201cHail\nMary\u201d Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor followed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">USA knew the attack for\ncoming\u2014 but the JEW President allowed it to happen <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/the-lie-of-pearl-harbour-revealed-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/the-lie-of-pearl-harbour-revealed-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Psychologically, it is\nnecessary to categorize one's enemy as sub-human in order to legitimize\nincreased violence or justify the violation of basic human rights. Moral\nexclusion reduces restraints against harming or exploiting certain groups of\npeople. In severe cases, dehumanization makes the violation of generally\naccepted norms of behavior regarding one's fellow man seem reasonable, or even\nnecessary.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dehumanization is\nactually an extension of a less intense process of developing an \"enemy\nimage\" of the opponent. During the course of protracted conflict, feelings\nof anger, fear, and distrust shape the way that the parties perceive each\nother.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adversarial attitudes and perceptions develop and parties begin to\nattribute negative traits to their opponent. They may come to view the opponent\nas an evil enemy, deficient in moral virtue, or as a dangerous, warlike\nmonster. In Pakistani terror camps the ISI does the dehumanization of HINDUS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An enemy image is a\nnegative stereotype through which the opposing group is viewed as evil, in\ncontrast to one's own side, which is seen as good. Such images can stem from a\ndesire for group identity and a need to contrast the distinctive attributes and\nvirtues of one's own group with the vices of the \"outside\" group. In\nsome cases, evil-ruler enemy images form. While ordinary group members are\nregarded as neutral, or perhaps even innocent, their leaders are viewed as\nhideous monsters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enemy images are\nusually black and white. The negative actions of one's opponent are thought to\nreflect their fundamental evil nature, traits, or motives.&nbsp; One's own faults, as well as the values and\nmotivations behind the actions of one's opponent, are usually discounted,\ndenied, or ignored. It becomes difficult to empathize or see where one's opponent\nis coming from. Meaningful communication is unlikely, and it becomes difficult\nto perceive any common ground.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once formed, enemy\nimages tend to resist change, and serve to perpetuate and intensify the\nconflict. Because the adversary has come to be viewed as a \"diabolical\nenemy,\" the conflict is framed as a war between good and evil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the parties have\nframed the conflict in this way, their positions become more rigid. In some\ncases, zero-sum thinking develops as parties come to believe that they must\neither secure their own victory, or face defeat. New goals to punish or destroy\nthe opponent arise, and in some cases more militant leadership comes into\npower.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enemy images are\naccentuated, by the process of \"projection,\" in which people\n\"project\" their own faults onto their opponents. This means that\npeople or groups who tend to be aggressive or selfish are likely to attribute\nthose traits to their opponents, but not to themselves. This improves one's own\nself-image and increases group cohesion, but it also escalates the conflict and\nmakes it easier to dehumanize the other side.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deindividuation\nfacilitates dehumanization as well. This is the psychological process whereby a\nperson is seen as a member of a category or group rather than as an individual.\nBecause people who are deindividuated seem less than fully human, they are\nviewed as less protected by social norms against aggression than those who are\nindividuated. It then becomes easier to rationalize contentious moves or severe\nactions taken against one's opponents.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SHIRK ISLAMIC PREACHERS\nIN NORTH KERALA FUNDED BY ZIONIST JEW SALAFI/ WAHHABI FUNDS ARE DEHUMANISING\nHINDUS. . .&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AND SO ARE THE KERALA\nCOMMIES&nbsp; FUNDED BY ZIOIST JEWS \u2013 CHECK\nOUT THE BRUTAL ATTACKS IN KANNUR<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once certain groups are\nstigmatized as evil, morally inferior, and not fully human, the persecution of\nthose groups becomes more psychologically acceptable. Restraints against\naggression and violence begin to disappear.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not surprisingly, dehumanization\nincreases the likelihood of violence and may cause a conflict to escalate out\nof control. Once a violence break over has occurred, it may seem even more\nacceptable for people to do things that they would have regarded as morally\nunthinkable before.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Parties may come to\nbelieve that destruction of the other side is necessary, and pursue an\noverwhelming victory that will cause one's opponent to simply disappear. This\nsort of into-the-sea framing can cause lasting damage to relationships between\nthe conflicting parties, making it more difficult to solve their underlying\nproblems and leading to the loss of more innocent lives.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indeed, dehumanization\noften paves the way for human rights violations, war crimes, and genocide. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The psychological\nprocess of dehumanization might be mitigated or reversed through humanization\nefforts, the development of empathy, the establishment of personal\nrelationships between conflicting parties, and the pursuit of common goals.<span style=\"background: aqua; mso-highlight: aqua;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UuMYpGhI07s/WACew31AtII/AAAAAAABMy0/GFIApnOMwywzZf7AtFi4vjsk1OlvNs_EACLcB/s1600/slAAide_15.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UuMYpGhI07s/WACew31AtII/AAAAAAABMy0/GFIApnOMwywzZf7AtFi4vjsk1OlvNs_EACLcB/s640/slAAide_15.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px;
